text: Acleris albiscapulana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in Japan (Hokkaido, Honshu, Shikoku), the Korean Peninsula and the Russian Far East (Ussuri).Acleris at funet The habitat consists of fir-yew broad-leaved and oak forests. The wingspan is 17–20 mm.Japanese Moths Adults have been recorded on wing from May to June and again from August to October. The species probably overwinters as an adult.Lepidopterous Fauna of the USSR and Adjacent Countries ==References== Category:Moths described in 1881 albiscapulana Category:Moths of Asia
title: Acleris albiscapulana
